column2: The ambitious and ruthless elites of the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]'s court strive to fulfil their goals and those of their [Root.TopLiege.GetMasterMistress]. The more powerful the court grows the more it will be able to accomplish. But the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] must be sure to maintain control, or else [Root.TopLiege.GetSheHe] will find [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] authority challenged.

The ambitious and ruthless elites of the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]'s court strive to fulfil their goals and those of their [Root.TopLiege.GetMasterMistress]. The more powerful the court grows the more it will be able to accomplish. But [Root.TopLiege.GetTitledFirstName] must be sure to maintain control, or else [Root.TopLiege.GetSheHe] will find [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] authority challenged.
Imperial Court of the Byzantine Empire

The Imperial Court of Constantinople is usually regarded as the most prestigious in all Christendom. The court is rife with opportunities to ascend to greatness, but not without opposition from those seeking the same. Those wise in court politics know that sometimes the pen is mightier than the sword. The balance of power between the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] and [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] inner council is ever shifting.
Imperial Court of the Holy Roman Empire

The Court of the Holy Roman Empire is ever filled with squabbling nobles seeking to further empower themselves within the empire, while others struggle to strengthen the empire itself. It falls to the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] to carefully manage this amalgamation of interests, lest civil war engulf the empire.
Imperial Court of the Arabian Empire

The court of the Islamic heartlands is often regarded as the most prestigious in the world, an outstanding exemplar of culture and refinement for the whole of the Dar al-Islam. But those wise in court politics know that beneath the glory and splendour, nothing is sacred - and not even the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] is safe from the intrigues of [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] subjects.
Imperial Court of the Roman Empire

The Roman Empire has been restored and with it the authority of Rome. The Eternal City is once again the center of the known world, its great buildings filled with senators, officials, and foreign dignataries all vying for the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]'s time. The Roman Court must be kept strong, but controlled carefully, so that Rome may never fall again.

The [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle] is the ruler of [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and leads the Imperial Court. Under [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] watchful eye, members of the Imperial Court work to seek [Root.TopLiege.GetHerHis] favor.

[Root.GetImperialRegentAssignableOffice] [Society.current_imperial_regent.GetFirstName] is the [Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]'s acting representative within the Imperial Court. Although [Society.current_imperial_regent.GetSheHe] is the leader of the court, [Society.current_imperial_regent.GetSheHe] does not have complete control and members may be more inclined to seek power for themselves.

Enables the decision to donate money in exchange for §Y[Root.Society.GetCurrency]§!. Becomes less efficient in higher ranks.
Enables the decision to visit the Imperial Capital. The different activities and events available there depend on the Imperial Buildings already built.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portraits of your children to make them join the Imperial Court, bypassing some of the usual requirements.
Enables the decision to turn a duchy viceroyalty into a hereditary duchy if the society's influence is high enough.
Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portraits of society members of lower rank to force them to owe you a favor.
Enables the decision to obtain one of three lifestyle traits unique to the society.

Able to hold one of four unique §MImperial Offices§! granted by the Imperial Court's leader which allow the holder to issue special missions to lower ranks and give access to a unique power. Office specific details are found in the associated character modifier located on the office holder.

Enables §Gright-clicking§! the portraits of direct vassals in order ro make them relinquish all non-de jure titles. Titles will be reassigned in the following manner.
  §Y*§! §YKingdoms:§! Will be given to a non-viceroy direct vassal of the §Y[Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]§! that owns de jure land within the §YKingdom§!. If no applicable vassal exists, the §YKingdom§! will revert to the §Y[Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]§!.
  §Y*§! §YDuchies:§!Will be given to a Count rank vassal that owns dejure land within the §YDuchy§!.
  §Y*§! §YCounties:§!Will be distributed to new vassals.
  §Y*§! All vassals will then be transferred to their de jure lieges if they exist, otherwise they will become direct vassals of the §Y[Root.TopLiege.GetTitle]§!.
